meanings.definition: A picture or image that creates a three-dimensional effect when viewed correctly.
meanings.sent1: The stereogram of the dolphin seemed to pop out when I focused my eyes.
meanings.sent2: I stared at the stereogram until the hidden image revealed itself.
meanings.sent3: The stereogram of the tree made me feel like I could reach out and touch the leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a stereogram of memories, each one vivid and distinct.
meanings.sent5: The stereogram of the spaceship was so realistic, it felt like it could fly off the page.

meanings.definition: A pattern or design that appears to be three-dimensional when viewed in a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The colorful stereogram on the wall seemed to come alive as I adjusted my focus.
meanings.sent2: The stereogram of the waves looked like they were moving when I gazed at it.
meanings.sent3: I tried to high-five the stereogram of the hand, but my hand just went through the wall.
meanings.sent4: His words created a stereogram of possibilities in her mind, each one more intriguing than the last.
meanings.sent5: The stereogram of the castle made me feel like I could walk through its gates and explore the grounds.
